newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Davids on track for A$8 bln sales.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Davids on track for A$8 bln sales.

text.p: Food wholesaler Davids Ltd said on Tuesday it was on target to achieve full year sales of A$8 billion in 1996/97.
Davids executive chairman John David said in the first half results statement the company was "on course to achieve its gross sales activity target of A$8 billion for the full year."
Gross sales activity includes statutory sales revenue, sales from Australian Liquor Marketers, which is 50 percent owned by Davids, inter-company sales and sales tax.
Gross sales for the first half were A$4.32 billion, up from A$3.13 billion previously.

This included sales not previously consolidated following the acquisition of retailer and wholesaler QIW Ltd in 1996, and the inclusion of a full period contribution from Jewel Food Stores Pty Ltd, David said.
Davids reported net sales for the first half of A$2.53 billion, against A$1.91 billion previously.
